fields.headline: Cricket World Cup Show
fields.bodyText: The hosts got the tournament off to a great start, beating Pakistan by 54 runs at Sabina Park. Joining Rob Curling in the pod are Lawrence Booth and Rob Smyth, who dissect West Indies' victory and look ahead to England's opener against New Zealand on Friday, asking and answering the important questions: should Monty Panesar play, and has Rob jinxed his tip to be the tournament's top wicket-taker, Rana Naved-ul-Hasan? As ever, please ping us your comments and questions below - we'll feature the best of your blogs on every show. Click here to listen now on your computer. Click here to subscribe free, via iTunes, and get the latest episode on your iPod every week. For the Cricket World Cup Show podcast feed, click here.
